subject: Problems with assertEquals()
msgSnippet: Hi, I m new in testing with JUnit and have a problem with assertEquals() . I wanna test if 2 objects are equal. The equals() -method in the class ... MyClass
messageBody:
Hi,

I'm new in testing with JUnit and have a problem with "assertEquals()".

I wanna test if 2 objects are equal. The "equals()"-method in the class
is self-written and the following asserts run fine:

----- snip -----
MyClass object1 = new MyClass();
MyClass object2 = new MyClass();

assertTrue(object1.equals(object2));
assertTrue(object2.equals(object1));
assertTrue((object1 != null && object1.equals(object2)));
----- snap -----

But if I wanna test directly with "assertEquals()" it breaks:

----- snip -----
assertEquals("My Test", object1, object2);
----- snap -----


The last line in the first code snippet is exactly the test
"assertEquals()" performs - but it returns an exception.

What am I doing wrong :-)? Does someone has a hint?
Perhaps I can't see the wood for trees - but I'm really at a loss.


TIA, Daniel
--
Noah war ein frommer Mann
und ohne Tadel zu seinen Zeiten;
er wandelte mit Gott.
1. Mose 6,9

Auch wir wollen,
da wir eine so große Wolke von Zeugen um uns haben,
jede hemmende Last und die uns so leicht umringende Sünde ablegen
und mit Ausdauer laufen in dem Wettkampf, der vor uns liegt.
Hebräer 12,1
